Is there another way to recover an identity in Verus, besides using the command line?

Yes, you can also recover an identity in Verus using a JSON-RPC call. This can be done using a tool like `curl`. The basic syntax is:
```
curl --user your_username --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "recoveridentity", "params": [{"name" : "your_identity_name"}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace `"your_username"` with your actual username, and `"your_identity_name"` with the actual name of the identity you want to recover.

Examples:
```bash
> verus recoveridentity '{"name" : "myname"}'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "recoveridentity", "params": ['{"name" : "myname"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
